title: Smash Up
description: Smash Up is a 2-4 player card battle game! Combine two different factions to compete for base control and victory points; the first to 15 points wins. The base game includes 8 distinct factions, enabling many strategic pairings and playstyles. (Year: 2012; Type: Competitive/Card; Rating: 7.2)

tutorial.title: Smash Up Tutorial
tutorial.welcome: Welcome to Smash Up! Combine two factions, fight for base control, and be the first to reach 15 victory points.
tutorial.finish: Tutorial complete — you are ready to smash up!

steps.welcome:
Welcome to Smash Up!

In this game, you pick two factions and shuffle their decks together, then compete to score bases and earn Victory Points.

First to 15 VP wins!
steps.scoreboard:
This is the scoreboard, showing each player's Victory Points (VP) and chosen factions.

Your goal is to reach 15 VP first!
steps.handIntro:
This is your hand area. Your deck is a mix of cards from your two factions.

Cards come in two types:
• Minions — placed on bases to contribute power
• Actions — trigger special effects
steps.turnTracker:
This shows the current turn number and game phase.

Each turn follows: Play Cards → Score Bases → Draw.
steps.endTurnBtn: This is the End Phase button. After you're done with each phase, click it to move on.
steps.playCardsExplain:
It's the Play Cards phase!

Each turn you may play 1 minion and 1 action (one of each).

Minions go on bases to add power; actions trigger special effects.
steps.playMinion:
Try playing a minion!

Click a minion card in your hand, then choose a base to place it on.
steps.playAction:
Nice! Now play an action card.

Click an action card in your hand to use it.
steps.useTalent:
Notice the glowing golden minion on the base!

Some minions have Talent abilities that can be activated once per turn.

Click the glowing minion on the base to use its Talent!
steps.endPlayCards: Done playing cards! Click the End Phase button to proceed.
steps.baseScoring:
Base Scoring: when the total power of all minions on a base reaches or exceeds its breakpoint, that base scores.

After scoring, minions on the base are discarded and a new base is revealed.
steps.vpAwards:
When a base scores, the top 3 players by power receive the VP rewards shown on the base card.

The player with the most power gets the biggest reward!
steps.drawExplain: Draw phase: at the end of each turn you draw 2 cards to refill your hand.
steps.handLimit:
Note the hand limit is 10 cards.

If you exceed the limit after drawing, you must discard down to 10.
steps.endDraw: Click the End Phase button to finish the draw phase.
steps.opponentTurn: It's your opponent's turn now. Watch what they do...
steps.talentIntro:
Some minions have Talent abilities that can be used once per turn.

Look for the Talent marker on minion cards! Talents reset at the start of your turn.
steps.turnCycle:
Turns alternate between players, each following Play Cards → Score → Draw.

Use your plays wisely to build power advantages on key bases!
steps.summary:
Tutorial complete! Key takeaways:

• Pick 2 factions and shuffle them together
• Each turn: play 1 minion + 1 action
• Bases score when total power hits the breakpoint
• First to 15 VP wins
steps.finish: You've learned the basics of Smash Up. Ready to smash?
